category.name: JUnit Extensions
category.description: The projects described below make it easier to create unit and integration tests that use JUnit.

project.name: Selenium JUnit 4 Runner
project.description:
The Selenium JUnit 4 Runner is a test runner for JUnit 4 that:
Reduces some of the boiler-plate required to write integration tests for Selenium using JUnit 4.
Make it easier to implement re-usable custom method rules.
Write integration tests to run against multiple browsers.

project.name: LDAPUnit
project.description:
LDAPUnit makes it easier to create unit tests for components that are dependent on an LDAP directory servers:
DirectoryServerRule is used launch an embedded LDAP directory server so that the unit tests do not have to be dependent on an external LDAP directory server with unpredictable state.
DirectoryTester is used to connect to an LDAP directory server (embedded or external) and make assertions about or verify the contents of the LDAP directory.
LDAPUnit relies on UnboundID LDAP SDK to run the embedded LDAP directory server and as the API used to connect to LDAP directory servers. DirectoryServerRule is based on the OpenDJRule implemented in the embedded-ldap project.

category.name: Maven Plugins
category.description: The projects described below are Maven plugins.

project.name: CRX Maven Plugin
project.description: A Maven plugin that collects the resources for a Google Chrome extension and packages then into a signed CRX archive.

project.name: LDAP Maven Plugin
project.description: A Maven plug-in that launches an embedded LDAP directory server intended for use in the creation of integration tests. The plugin uses Apache Directory.

project.name: In Memory Database Maven Plugin
project.description: A Maven plugin that launches an embedded database server intended for use in the creation of integration tests. The plugin supports HSQLDB, H2 and Apache Derby embedded databases.

project.name: e-Mail Server Maven Plugin
